Sean Sperte

Currently Chief Product Officer at Tagboard in Redmond, WA. I have over 20 years experience creating graphics, interfaces, presentations, and systems. While I have a wide gamut of tactical skills, I'm most proud of my strengths as a team leader and manager.

In 2009, I co-founded a company called Sky Balloon with two of my colleagues. We develop iPhone apps in our spare time, and have a user install base of over 300,000. Our most popular app is a quick-launch video camera, called Capture.

In 2011, I left my career of almost 13 years to co-found Tagboard, a social media curation platform based on the hashtag. As Chief Product Officer, my role is to help lead and drive the product roadmap.

Below is my blog.

27 January 2007

Palm Brings Microsoft’s Direct Push Technology to Palm OS Based Treo Smartphones

Palm Brings Microsoft’s Direct Push Technology to Palm OS Based Treo Smartphones. Uh oh. Now do I nab a 680 while I await the iPhone?

24 January 2007

Kem Vows to Get Tattoo on Stage

Kem Meyer says she’ll get a tattoo on stage if 1,000 people show up for Innovate 2007, a conference her church is hosting. Guts right there, folks. Guts.

What is VIRB? Did you get invited?

What is VIRB? Did you get invited? I hear the rumble of viral marketing.

Update: I’m giving away Virb invites now.

22 January 2007

Wii - Known Incompatible Routers

It sucks when you bring home your brand new Nintendo Wii and discover your cable modem/router is listed on this page of known, incompatible routers.

17 January 2007

Running from Camera

Running from Camera. “The rules are simple: I put the self-timer on 2 seconds, push the button and try to get as far from the camera as I can.” (Via Blankenship.)

Rumor: Apple to license FairPlay DRM. This could change everything (again).

DoCoMo’s new phones feature touch panel, smell. Yes, smell. Brings a new meaning to the saying, “Don’t answer. That call smells like trouble.”
